text: Circle is a city in Alaska, United States. Circle is the end of the Pan- American Highway. The town started in 1893 because gold was found in Birch Creek.Haycox, Stephen, Alaska: An American Colony (University of Washington Press, 2002), pp. 201-02. Circle was named by miners who believed the town was on the Arctic Circle. The Arctic Circle is actually about north. Each February, the town has a checkpoint for the long-distance Yukon Quest sled dog race. ==References== Category:Cities in Alaska Category:1893 establishments in the United States Category:19th-century establishments in Alaska
title: Circle, Alaska
